Problem


Attempting to open the Cash Flow Module and it errors out, perhaps even locks up the computer/forces an exit.


Resolution


Log into JobBOSS


Switch to a different database than the one that errors out.


Select the Cash Flow module


 Assuming it opens error-free, access the Data Included button and uncheck every box.



OK


Close the Cash Flow Module


Switch back to the database having the problem opening the Cash Flow Module.


Try to open the Cash Flow Module. It should open error-free as it is only now trying to load the open cash, payable and receivable balances.


Access the Sources button


Select the first inflow


OK


The module should now include the selected item in the results. If it presents the data error-free, go back to Sources.
Select the next inflow


OK


Repeat these steps until you find the 'Source' that causes the Cash Flow Module to error out.   The data for that particular item will need to be evaluated to determine what is ultimately causing the error.

title: JobBOSS - Performance issues - Data Clean Up Recommendations
text: JobBOSS - Performance issues - Data Clean Up Recommendations This article is regarding performance issues after updating to 12x or greater. Applies to Customers receiving "Out of Memory" errors, unable to enter modules, modules do not load, receiving errors after update going into modules, reports that do not complete, a delay in searches, or extended wait time for reports. Cause New user interface components were added in JobBOSS version 12 and higher. These grids interact with data and system resources differently than previous JobBOSS versions. Resolution The latest release will have the most current fixes relating to these UI components. If you are not on at least 17.0, we suggest you update JobBOSS. The following information serves to aid in cleaning up open, old, or otherwise irrelevant data, which could be returned when running reports or attempting to use modules in the software. Step 1: Job Entry Module Close all Jobs that are no longer in process. JobBOSS will never automatically close a job. The status will automatically change to Complete, but that does not close out the material requirements on the job. Close all jobs that are finished. Most JobBOSS users will close a job once they receive final payment from their customer, though it is sometimes closed earlier. The Convert Jobs feature from the JBUtil.exe Utility set on the customer portal allows you to close multiple jobs at a time. The utility is in \Utilities within your JobBOSS Server share. This utility allows you to narrow your search by status and date. Start with closing all jobs that are currently in a status of Complete and run it in batches by date. Whether that’s one month at a time or one year at a time is up to you. Keep in mind that Windows may state that the utility is Not Responding. Ignore that indication; it will eventually finish on its own. If you must end the task, use a smaller date range the next time so you have a smaller set of jobs to close. If you are closing large batches (more than 20 at a time), then Support suggests running the Utility after hours as it may slow down JobBOSS for everyone. Step 2: Run Data Doctor and Mass Close POs features from the JBUtil Utility Set Within Data Doctor are several queries that fix common data inconsistencies in the application. The Mass Close POs feature simply closes all PO Header lines that have all lines closed. Data Doctor is found in JBUtil.exe, included in the JobBOSS Server\Utilities shared folder on the server. (JobBOSS 12.1 and above) Step 3: Purchase orders Check Open Purchase Orders. Close any Old POs that are no longer valid. There are no utilities to auto close purchase orders; this must be done manually. To find open POs, you can search within the module and change the status filter to Open, OR run a Purchase Order Summary report and select Open status. Step 4: Quotes Quote status will never change on its own, unless it is copied from a quote to a job; then the line status will change to WON. Line and header status do not change on their own under any other circumstance. Quotes that are active will be queried in modules such as ShopStats. Improper quote management will lead to inaccurate data and a "bloated" dataset, which results in longer times to wait for results. JobBOSS - Utility for Quote Expiration contains two utilities which can be used to help you manage your quotes. Step 5: Sales orders Sales order status will only change when: A line is shipped; then the line is updated to reflect shipped. If partial shipment; then the status is set to backorder. Once invoiced, the SO status will update to closed. It is suggested to review open SOs to validate the system is correct. Step 6: Database Maintenance Your data is one of the most important assets of your business, and we want to ensure that your JobBOSS and other softwares are properly backed up so you can focus on other aspects of running your shop. Since every manufacturing shop could have a different server setup, software version, number and type of applications running, and backup schedule needed, we are requiring that customers acknowledge they are using dedicated backup software before updating to the latest version of JobBOSS. Just the same as you trust JobBOSS to be your shop ERP, we want you to back up your data with software from a company that focuses resources on building and maintaining backup software to protect you from failures, outages, and unplanned disasters. JobBOSS uses databases to store your data. These databases are managed via a product called Microsoft SQL. Microsoft has recommended maintenance for databases. JobBOSS does not run this maintenance for you. It is generally something that your IT staff sets up, manages and monitors; it isn’t something that the JobBOSS Support staff does for you. The tasks are at minimum: Backup of the SQL Database Truncate and Shrink of the Log file Reindex of the main database file If you do not have an IT Resource capable of performing these tasks, we have Technical Consultants in the Professional Services department that can assist you. These services are billable. If you would like a quote, contact your Account Manager at 1-800-777-4334. Should you wish to continue using this utility, it is provided 100% as-is. Support has been instructed to provide no support for this utility. See Progression - SQL 2005/2008 Client Network Utility with Progression. Step 7: Financials tab AR and AP invoice data are reported here. If the Financials tab is generating errors, we suggest you audit your AP/AR performance, as well as Banks within JobBOSS. To review AP/AR performance under reports, in JobBOSS browse to Accounts Receivable > AR Aging and Accounts Payable > AP Aging. These reports will return aging information and report what is outstanding. The Cash section within Financials tab returns balances in accounts that are set up within System Administration > Accounting Preferences > Banks tab. Step 8: Environment It is common to see performance issues with the JobBOSS product as the result of a misconfigured/improper environment. Consider network medium, raid level, disk type, hardware, and load. From Support we do not audit your environment for these issues; this would be the role and responsibility of your IT resource. If you are having issues with a new installation of JB, we first suggest that you carefully review the first time install documents. If this is an established environment, start with reviewing system resources and Windows Event Viewer for events pertaining to your environment. Ensure there are no events for active directory, time, or DNS. Audit your antivirus and backup software schedules. If you have a problem statement that JobBOSS is slow at a certain time of day, then we recommend that you review these areas within your environment. We would further suggest reviewing MS best practices relating to Windows features/roles and SQL Server. JobBOSS does not have any scheduled tasks which run in standard configuration. Performance is extremely subjective. When tracking a performance issue, one thing to note is if it occurs for all or some JobBOSS users, or on all or some Windows stations, and even on the server itself. Use a stopwatch as a guide (to measure).
description:
JobBOSS - Performance issues - Data Clean Up Recommendations


This article is regarding performance issues after updating to 12x or greater.

 

Applies to


Customers receiving "Out of Memory" errors, unable to enter modules, modules do not load, receiving errors after update going into modules, reports that do not complete, a delay in searches, or extended wait time for reports.

 

Cause


New user interface components were added in JobBOSS version 12 and higher. These grids interact with data and system resources differently than previous JobBOSS versions.

 

Resolution


The latest release will have the most current fixes relating to these UI components. If you are not on at least 17.0, we suggest you update JobBOSS.

 

The following information serves to aid in cleaning up open, old, or otherwise irrelevant data, which could be returned when running reports or attempting to use modules in the software.

 

Step 1: Job Entry Module


Close all Jobs that are no longer in process. JobBOSS will never automatically close a job. The status will automatically change to Complete, but that does not close out the material requirements on the job. Close all jobs that are finished. Most JobBOSS users will close a job once they receive final payment from their customer, though it is sometimes closed earlier.

 

The Convert Jobs feature from the JBUtil.exe Utility set on the customer portal allows you to close multiple jobs at a time. The utility is in \Utilities within your JobBOSS Server share. This utility allows you to narrow your search by status and date. Start with closing all jobs that are currently in a status of Complete and run it in batches by date. Whether that’s one month at a time or one year at a time is up to you.  Keep in mind that Windows may state that the utility is Not Responding. Ignore that indication; it will eventually finish on its own. If you must end the task, use a smaller date range the next time so you have a smaller set of jobs to close.

If you are closing large batches (more than 20 at a time), then Support suggests running the Utility after hours as it may slow down JobBOSS for everyone.

 

 

Step 2: Run Data Doctor and Mass Close POs features from the JBUtil Utility Set


Within Data Doctor are several queries that fix common data inconsistencies in the application. The Mass Close POs feature simply closes all PO Header lines that have all lines closed. Data Doctor is found in JBUtil.exe, included in the JobBOSS Server\Utilities shared folder on the server. (JobBOSS 12.1 and above) 

 

 

Step 3: Purchase orders


Check Open Purchase Orders. Close any Old POs that are no longer valid. There are no utilities to auto close purchase orders; this must be done manually. To find open POs, you can search within the module and change the status filter to Open, OR run a Purchase Order Summary report and select Open status.

 

 

Step 4: Quotes


Quote status will never change on its own, unless it is copied from a quote to a job; then the line status will change to WON. Line and header status do not change on their own under any other circumstance. Quotes that are active will be queried in modules such as ShopStats. Improper quote management will lead to inaccurate data and a "bloated" dataset, which results in longer times to wait for results.

 

JobBOSS - Utility for Quote Expiration contains two utilities which can be used to help you manage your quotes.

 

 

Step 5: Sales orders


Sales order status will only change when:

  • A line is shipped; then the line is updated to reflect shipped. 
  • If partial shipment; then the status is set to backorder.
  • Once invoiced, the SO status will update to closed.

It is suggested to review open SOs to validate the system is correct. 

 

 

Step 6: Database Maintenance


Your data is one of the most important assets of your business, and we want to ensure that your JobBOSS and other softwares are properly backed up so you can focus on other aspects of running your shop. Since every manufacturing shop could have a different server setup, software version, number and type of applications running, and backup schedule needed, we are requiring that customers acknowledge they are using dedicated backup software before updating to the latest version of JobBOSS. Just the same as you trust JobBOSS to be your shop ERP, we want you to back up your data with software from a company that focuses resources on building and maintaining backup software to protect you from failures, outages, and unplanned disasters. 

 

JobBOSS uses databases to store your data. These databases are managed via a product called Microsoft SQL. Microsoft has recommended maintenance for databases. JobBOSS does not run this maintenance for you. It is generally something that your IT staff sets up, manages and monitors; it isn’t something that the JobBOSS Support staff does for you.

  

The tasks are at minimum:

  1. Backup of the SQL Database
  2. Truncate and Shrink of the Log file
  3. Reindex of the main database file

 

If you do not have an IT Resource capable of performing these tasks, we have Technical Consultants in the Professional Services department that can assist you. These services are billable. If you would like a quote, contact your Account Manager at 1-800-777-4334.

 

Should you wish to continue using this utility, it is provided 100% as-is.  Support has been instructed to provide no support for this utility. See Progression - SQL 2005/2008 Client Network Utility with Progression. 

 

 

Step 7: Financials tab


AR and AP invoice data are reported here. If the Financials tab is generating errors, we suggest you audit your AP/AR performance, as well as Banks within JobBOSS. To review AP/AR performance under reports, in JobBOSS browse to Accounts Receivable > AR Aging and Accounts Payable > AP Aging.  These reports will return aging information and report what is outstanding. The Cash section within Financials tab returns balances in accounts that are set up within System Administration > Accounting Preferences > Banks tab.

 

 

Step 8: Environment


It is common to see performance issues with the JobBOSS product as the result of a misconfigured/improper environment. Consider network medium, raid level, disk type, hardware, and load. From Support we do not audit your environment for these issues; this would be the role and responsibility of your IT resource. If you are having issues with a new installation of JB, we first suggest that you carefully review the first time install documents. If this is an established environment, start with reviewing system resources and Windows Event Viewer for events pertaining to your environment. Ensure there are no events for active directory, time, or DNS. Audit your antivirus and backup software schedules. If you have a problem statement that JobBOSS is slow at a certain time of day, then we recommend that you review these areas within your environment. We would further suggest reviewing MS best practices relating to Windows features/roles and SQL Server. 

 

JobBOSS does not have any scheduled tasks which run in standard configuration. 

 

Performance is extremely subjective. When tracking a performance issue, one thing to note is if it occurs for all or some JobBOSS users, or on all or some Windows stations, and even on the server itself. Use a stopwatch as a guide (to measure).

title: JobBOSS - Vendor Reference Change in Function
text: Versions JobBOSS 2020 SP1 Applies to Customers who have updated to JobBOSS 2020 SP1 or new, and now note that a vendor reference is no longer displayed on the Material General Tab Problem There was a change in product functionality around Vendor References for materials. This change will now allow for Vendor Specific references to be used on a per material basis. A valid Vendor and reference is now required. Cause N/A Resolution This functionality now requires a Vendor and Reference to be specified on the Vendor tab of the material. Vendor references without an assigned vendor will no longer display a reference on the General tab. This will now allow for Vendor Specific references to be utilized, for example when generating a Purchase Order and toggling a vendor you’ll now note the Vendor Reference will change with a Vendor change. To set a Vendor reference: Log into JobBOSS and navigate to module: System Administration > Material Load material in question Click into Vendor tab. Click + icon and select Add Vendor In the Vendor Selection window, locate and select a Vendor then click OK Add the reference for this Vendor If desired, set Lead Days, Unit Price, Purchase UofM, and Minimum Qty Click Save If desired, click into General tab and set a Primary Vendor and click save.
description:
Versions
JobBOSS 2020 SP1
 
Applies to
Customers who have updated to JobBOSS 2020 SP1 or new, and now note that a vendor reference is no longer displayed on the Material General Tab 


Problem
There was a change in product functionality around Vendor References for materials.  This change will now allow for Vendor Specific references to be used on a per material basis.  A valid Vendor and reference is now required.
 

Cause
N/A


Resolution
This functionality now requires a Vendor and Reference to be specified on the Vendor tab of the material. Vendor references without an assigned vendor will no longer display a reference on the General tab. This will now allow for Vendor Specific references to be utilized, for example when generating a Purchase Order and toggling a vendor you’ll now note the Vendor Reference will change with a Vendor change.

To set a Vendor reference:

  1. Log into JobBOSS and navigate to module: System Administration > Material
  2. Load material in question
  3. Click into Vendor tab.
  4. Click + icon and select Add Vendor
  5. In the Vendor Selection window, locate and select a Vendor then click OK
  6. Add the reference for this Vendor
  7. If desired, set Lead Days, Unit Price, Purchase UofM, and Minimum Qty
  8. Click Save
  9. If desired, click into General tab and set a Primary Vendor and click save.
